en_dmt: "His body cracks open like dry wood that is bent.  "

text: बुद्धिप्रसादं बलमिन्द्रियाणां धातुस्थिरत्वं ज्वलनस्य दीप्तिम्। चिराच्च पाकं वयसः करोति। संशोधनं सम्यगुपास्यमानम्॥
en_dmt: "Clarity and expansion of intellect (buddhiprasāda), strength (balam) of the senses (indriyāṇām), stability of the *dhātus* (dhātusthiratva), brightness of the digestive fire (jvalanasya dīptim), and after a long time, it brings about the digestion according to age (cirācca pākaṃ vayasaḥ karoti). Purification (saṃśodhana) should be properly practiced (samyagupāsyamānam).  "

text: इति श्रीवलैद्यपतिसिंहगुप्तसूनुश्रीमद्वाग्भटविरचिता- यामष्टाङ्गहृदयसंहितायां सूत्रस्थाने वमनविरे- चनविधिर्नामाष्टादशोऽध्यायः॥
en_dmt: "Thus, in the Aṣṭāṅgahṛdayasaṃhitā, composed by the illustrious Vāgbhaṭa, son of Śrī Siṃhagupta, the physician of Valā, in the Sūtrasthāna, is the eighteenth chapter named \"The Procedure for Emesis and Purgation.\"  "

text: एकोनविंशोऽध्यायः अथातो बस्तिविधिमध्यायं व्याख्यास्यामः। इति ह स्माहुरात्रेयादयो महर्षयः।
en_dmt: "The Nineteenth Chapter. Now, therefore, we shall expound the chapter on the method of enema administration (bastividhi). Thus spoke the great sages Ātreya, etc.  "

text: वातोल्बणेषु दोषेषु वाते वा बस्तिरिष्यते। उपक्रमणां सर्वेषां सोऽग्रणीस्रिवधस्तु सः॥
en_dmt: "In disorders where *vāta* is dominant, or in *vāta* [disorders], an enema is recommended. Among all therapies, that is the best, triple [in its] effect.  "

text: निरूहोऽन्वासनं बस्तिरुत्तरस्तेन साधयेत्। गुल्माऽनाह-खुड-प्लीह-शुद्धाऽतीसार-शूलिनः॥
en_dmt: "One should treat with enemas, oil enemas, and urethral suppositories those suffering from abdominal tumors, flatulence, khuḍa, splenomegaly, dysentery, and colic.  "

text: जीर्णज्वर-प्रतिश्याय-शुक्राऽनिलमलग्रहान्। बर्ध्माऽश्मरीरजोनाशान् दारुणांश्चाऽनिलामयान्॥
en_dmt: "[It destroys] chronic fever, colds, semen, wind, constipation, seizures, hernias, stones, impurities, and terrible diseases caused by wind.  "

text: अनास्थाप्यस्त्वतिस्निग्धः क्षतोरस्को भृशं कृशः। आमातिसारी वमिमान् संशुद्धौ दत्त-नावनः॥ श्वसकासप्रसेकार्सोहिध्माध्मानाल्पवह्नयः। शूनपायुः कृताहारो बद्धच्छिद्रोदकोदरी॥ कुष्ठी च मधुमेही च मासान् सप्त च गर्भीणी। आस्थाप्या एव चान्वास्या विशेषादतिवह्नयः॥
en_dmt: "\"However, one who is excessively oleated, has a wounded chest, is extremely emaciated, suffers from *āmātisāra* (diarrhea due to undigested food), is vomiting, has undergone purification therapy, has been given nasal medication, is suffering from dyspnea, cough, excessive salivation, piles, hiccup, abdominal distension, diminished digestive power, has swelling in the anus, has taken food, suffers from *baddhodara* (constipation with abdominal distension), *chiddodara* (perforation of the abdomen), or *udakodara* (ascites), also one who is suffering from leprosy or *madhumeha* (diabetes), a pregnant woman in her seventh month, and especially those with excessive digestive fire, are not suitable for *āsthāpana* enema but are suitable for *anuvāsana* enema.\"  "

text: रूक्षाः केवलवातार्ताः नानुवास्यास्त एव च। येऽनास्थाप्यास्तथा पाण्डुकामलामेहपीनासाः॥
en_dmt: "Those who are rough, afflicted only by *vāta* (wind), and not suitable for *anuvāsanā* enema, as well as those who are not suitable for *āsthāpana* enema, and those suffering from *pāṇḍu* (anemia), *kāmalā* (jaundice), *meha* (urinary disorders), *pīnasa* (rhinitis), [should not be treated with this].  "

text: निरन्नप्लीहविड्_भेदिगुरुकोष्ठकफोदराः। अभिष्यन्दिकृशस्थूलकृमिकोष्ठाढ्यमारुताः॥ पीते विषे गरेऽपच्यां श्लीपदौ गलगण्डवान्। तयोस्तु नेत्रं हेमादिधातुदार्वस्थिवेणुजम्॥
en_dmt: "Those who do not take food, who have splenomegaly, who have looseness of the bowels, who have heaviness in the abdomen, who have excess of *kapha*, who have *udara* disease, who have *abhiṣyandi*, who are emaciated, who are obese, who have worms in the abdomen, and who have excess of *vāta*;  In cases of poisoning, artificial poisoning, scrofula, elephantiasis, and goiter;  Of these two, the eye may be made of gold and other metals, wood, bone, or bamboo.  "

text: गोपुच्छाकारमच्छिद्रं श्लक्ष्णर्जुगुलिकामुखम्। ऊनेऽब्दे पञ्च, पूर्णेऽस्मिन्नासप्तभ्योऽङ्गुलानि षट्_॥
en_dmt: "[The leech should be] shaped like a cow's tail, without holes, smooth, straight, and with a mouth like a pill. In a child less than one year old, five aṅgulas [should be bled]; in one who is a year old, six aṅgulas from the seventh [vein].  "

text: सप्तमे सप्त, तान्यष्टौ द्वादशे, षोडशे नव। द्वादशैव परं विंशाद्वीक्ष्य वर्षान्तरेषु च॥ वयोबलशरीराणि प्रमाणमभिवर्द्धयेत्। स्वाङ्गुष्ठेन समं मूले स्थौल्येनाग्रे कनिष्ठया॥
en_dmt: "In the seventh [year], seven; those [become] eight in the twelfth, nine in the sixteenth. Twelve indeed beyond the twentieth, observing the intervening years.  One should increase the measure according to age, strength, and body size. At the base, the thickness is equal to one's own thumb; at the tip, it is the size of the little finger.  "

text: पूर्णेऽब्देऽङ्गुलमादाय तदर्धार्धप्रवर्धितम्। त्र्यङ्गुलं परमं छिद्रं मूलेऽग्रे वहते तु यत्॥ मुद्गं माषं कलायं च क्लिन्नं कर्कन्धुकं क्रमात्। मूलच्छिद्रप्रमाणेन प्रान्ते घटितकर्णिकम्॥
en_dmt: "Having taken a finger-breadth at the completion of a year, that is increased by half and half.  That hole at the base which can hold three finger-tips is best. Soaked *mudga*, *māṣa* and *kalāya* beans, [and], successively, *karkandhuka*.  With the measure of the hole at the base, the *karṇikā* is fitted at the end.  "

text: वर्त्याऽग्रे पिहितं, मूले यथास्वं द्व्यङ्गुलान्तरम्। कर्णिकाद्वितयं नेत्रे कुर्यात् तत्र च योजयेत्॥
en_dmt: "[It is] closed at the wick's tip, with a two-aṅgula distance at the base as appropriate. Two *karṇikā*s (seed-vessels, or small rings) should be made for the eyes and applied there.  "

text: अजाविमहिषादीनां बस्तिं सुमृदितं दृढम्। कषायरक्तं निश्छिद्रग्रन्थिगन्धशिरं तनुम्॥ ग्रथितं साधु सूत्रेण सुखसंस्थाप्यभेषजम्। बसेत्यभावेऽङ्कपादं वा न्यसेद्वासोऽथवा घनम्॥
en_dmt: "The bladder of goats, sheep, buffalo, etc., well-softened, firm, astringent and red, without holes, knots, odor, veins, and thin; The medicine, well-placed, should be carefully tied with thread; In the absence of *basti*, one should apply pressure with the lap or foot, or else a thick cloth.  "

text: निरूहमात्रा प्रथमे प्रकुञ्चो वत्सरात्परम्। प्रकुञ्चवृद्धिः प्रत्यब्दं यावत्षट्_ प्रसृतास्ततः॥ प्रसृतं वर्धयेदूर्ध्वं द्वादशाष्टादशस्य तु। आसप्ततेरिदं मानं, दशैव प्रसृताः परम्॥
en_dmt: "Nirūha-mātrā [is the measure] at first; a *prakuñca* after a year.  The increase of a *prakuñca* [occurs] every year until six *prasṛtas*; thereafter,  one should increase a *prasṛta* upwards [from] twelve to eighteen.  This is the measure up to seventy; ten *prasṛtas* thereafter.  "

text: यथायथं निरूहस्य पादो मात्राऽनुवासने। आस्थाप्यं स्नेहितं स्विन्नं शुद्धं लब्धबलं पुनः॥
en_dmt: "According to the specific determination, a *pāda* (quarter) in *mātrā* (prosody) [is used] in *anuvāsana* (oil enema). After that, *āsthāpya* (decoction enema), *snehita* (oleation), *svinna* (sudation), and *śuddha* (purification) [are performed], and strength is regained.  "

text: अन्वासनार्हं विज्ञाय पूर्वमेवानुवासयेत्। शीते वसन्ते च दिवा रात्रौ केचित्ततोऽन्यदा॥ अभ्यक्तस्नातमुचितात्पादहीनं हितं लघु। अस्निग्धरूक्षमशितं सानुपानं द्रवादि च॥ कृतचङ्क्रमणं मुक्तविण्मूत्रं शयने सुखे। नात्युच्छ्रिते न चोच्छीर्षे संविष्टं वामपार्श्वतः॥ सङ्कोच्य दक्षिणं सक्थि प्रसार्य च ततोऽपरम्। अथास्य नेत्रं प्रणयेत्स्निग्धे स्निग्धमुखं गुदे॥
en_dmt: "Having determined that [the patient] is suitable for an unctuous enema, one should administer it immediately. In winter and spring, [it should be given] during the day; some say at night at other times.  [Food that is] beneficial and light, one-quarter less than appropriate, after anointing and bathing, [as well as food that is] non-unctuous and rough, eaten with a drink, such as liquid, etc.  Having walked back and forth and evacuated feces and urine, [one should lie down] comfortably in bed, neither too high nor with the head raised, lying on the left side.  With the right thigh bent and then the other extended.  Then, one should apply [the enema] to his anus, with the tip and the anus having been anointed with oil.  "

text: उच्छ्वास्य बस्तेर्वदने बद्धे हस्तमकम्पयन्। पृष्ठवंशं प्रति ततो नातिद्रुतविलम्बितम्॥ नातिवेगं न वा मन्दं सकृदेव प्रपीडयेत्। सावशेषं च कुर्वीत वायुः शेषे हि तिष्ठति॥
en_dmt: "Having exhaled, and with the opening of the *basti* (bladder) tied, without shaking the hand, Then towards the spine, neither too quickly nor too slowly, Neither too forcefully nor too gently, one should press it just once. And one should do it leaving some remaining, for the *vāyu* (wind) remains in what is left.  "

text: दत्ते तूत्तानदेहस्य पाणिना ताडयेत्स्फिजौ। तत्पार्ष्णिभ्यां तथा शय्यां पादतश्च त्रिरुत्क्षिपेत्॥ ततः प्रसारिताङ्गस्य सोपधानस्य पार्ष्णिके। आहन्यान्मुष्टिनाऽङ्गं च स्नेहेनाभ्यज्य मर्दयेत्॥ वेदनार्तमिति स्नेहो न हि शीघ्रं निवर्तते। योज्यः शीघ्रं निवृत्तेऽन्यः स्नेहोऽतिष्ठन्नकार्यकृत्॥
en_dmt: "Having given [the child] [to the nurse], one should strike the buttocks of the child lying on its back with the palm [of the hand]. One should lift the bed three times with its heels and feet. Then, at the heels of the one whose limbs are stretched out and who has a pillow, one should strike the body with the fist and massage it, having anointed it with oil. Because of [the] painful sensation, the oil/unctuous substance does not return quickly. When it quickly returns, another oil should be applied; oil that does not stay does not accomplish its purpose.  "

text: दीप्ताग्निं त्वागतस्नेहं सायाह्ने भोजयेल्लघु। निवृत्तिकालः परमस्रयो यामास्ततः परम्॥
en_dmt: "In the evening, one should feed [him] lightly with food containing clarified butter that has been offered to a blazing fire. The time for cessation [of food intake] is three *yāmas* after that, which is the supreme [limit].  "

text: अहोरात्रमुपेक्षेत, परतः फलवर्तिभिः। तीक्ष्णैर्वा बस्तिभिः कुर्याद्यत्नं स्नेहनिवृत्तये॥
en_dmt: "One should disregard [food] day and night, and afterwards, [eat] fruit-based [foods]. Or, one should make an effort to eliminate oiliness with sharp enemas.  "

text: अतिरौक्ष्यादनागच्छन्न चेज्जाड्यादिदोषकृत्। उपेक्षेतैव हि ततोऽध्युषितश्च निशां पिबेत्। प्रातर्नागरधान्याम्भः कोष्णं, केवलमेव वा। अन्वासयेत्तृतीयेऽह्नि पञ्चमे वा पुनश्च तम्॥
en_dmt: "If, due to excessive dryness, it does not come, and if it causes defects such as dullness, one should remain indifferent; then, having spent the night, one should drink. In the morning, [one should drink] warm water boiled with ginger and dhānyaka, or just plain [warm water]. One should administer it again on the third or fifth day.  "

text: यथा वा स्नेहपक्तिः स्यादतोऽत्युल्बणमारुतान्। व्यायामनित्यान् दीप्ताग्नीन् रूक्षांश्च प्रतिवासरम्॥
en_dmt: "Just as the digestion of oily food is [difficult], so too [it is difficult to bear] extremely violent winds, those who are accustomed to exercise, those with a strong digestive fire (dīptāgni), and those who are rough (rūkṣa) every day.  "

text: इति स्नेहैस्रिचतुरैः स्निग्धे स्रोतोविशुद्धये। निरूहं शोधनं युञ्ज्यादस्निग्धे स्नेहनं तनोः॥
en_dmt: "Thus, with oily substances, three or four [times], for the purification of the channels when oily; One should apply a cleansing enema when not oily, and oleation for the body.  "

text: पञ्चमेऽथ तृतीये वा दिवसे साधके शुभे। मध्याह्ने किञ्चिदावृत्ते प्रयुक्ते बलिमङ्गले॥ अभ्यक्तस्वेदितोत्सृष्टमलं नातिबुभुक्षितम्। अवेक्ष्य पुरुषं दोषभेषजादीनि चादरात्॥ बस्तिं प्रकल्पयेद्वैद्यस्तद्विद्यैर्बहुभिः सहः। क्वाथयोद्विंशतिपलं द्रव्यस्याष्टौ फलानि च॥
en_dmt: "On the third or the fifth day, [which is] an auspicious and virtuous [date], when the midday has slightly passed, a propitiatory and auspicious offering is made.  [The patient should be] oiled, sweated, and have eliminated impurities, and not be too hungry.  Having carefully examined the person, the imbalances, medicines, and so on,  the physician, along with many who possess that knowledge, should administer an enema.  One should boil twenty *pala*s of [the medicinal] substance, and eight fruits.  "

text: ततः क्वाथाच्चतुर्थांशं स्नेहं वाते प्रकल्पयेत्। पित्ते स्वस्थे च षष्ठांशमष्टमांशं कफेऽधिके॥ सर्वत्र चाष्टमं भागं कल्काद्भवति वा यथा। नात्यच्छसान्द्रता बस्तेः पलमात्रं गुडस्य च॥ मधुपट्वादिशेषं च युक्त्या सर्वं तदेकतः। उष्णाम्बुकुम्भीबाष्पेण तप्तं खजसमाहतम्॥
en_dmt: "Then, one fourth of the decoction should be added to oil for *vāta*. When *pitta* is normal, one sixth [should be added], and when *kapha* is excessive, one eighth. Everywhere, one eighth part of the *kalka* [paste] should be added, or as appropriate. The enema should not be too clear or too thick, and [should contain] one *pala* of *guḍa* [jaggery]. Honey, rock salt, and other remaining [ingredients] should be added appropriately, all together. [It should be] heated with the steam of a pot of hot water and stirred with a date [branch].  "

text: प्रक्षिप्य बस्तौ प्रणयेत्पायौ नात्युष्णशीतलम्। नातिस्निग्धं न वा रूक्षं नातितीक्ष्णं न वा मृदु॥ नात्यच्छसान्द्रं नोनातिमात्रं नापटु नाति च। लवणं तद्वदम्लं च पठन्त्यन्ते तु तद्विदः॥
en_dmt: "Having poured [the enema fluid] into the bladder, one should administer [it] into the anus, [making sure it is] neither too hot nor too cold. Neither too oily nor too rough, neither too sharp nor too mild. Neither too clear nor too thick, neither too little nor too much, neither unskillful nor too much. Similarly, salt and sour, those who know that, recite at the end.  "

text: मात्रां त्रिपलिकां कृर्यात्स्नेहमाक्षिकयोः पृथक्। कर्षार्धं माणिमन्थस्य स्वस्थे कल्कपलद्वयम्॥ सर्वद्रवाणां शोषाणां पलानि दश कल्पयेत्। माक्षिकं लवणं स्नेहं कल्कं क्वाथमिति क्रमात्॥
en_dmt: "One should make the quantity of oil and honey separately three *palas* each. For a healthy person, half a *karsha* of *maṇimantha* and two *palas* of *kalka* [should be given]. One should prepare ten *palas* of all the remaining dried substances. Honey (*māksika*), salt (*lavaṇa*), oil (*sneha*), *kalka*, and decoction (*kvātha*) [should be added] in that order.  "

text: आवषेत निरूहाणामेष संयोजने विधिः। उत्तानो दत्तमात्रे तु निरूहे तन्मना भवेत्॥
en_dmt: "This is the procedure for combining decoctions with enemas: When the enema is administered with the patient lying on his back, he should be attentive.  "

text: कृतोपधानः सञ्जातवेगश्चोत्कटकः सृजेत्। आगतौ परमः कालो मुहूर्तो मृत्यवे परम्॥
en_dmt: "Having prepared the poultice, when the force has arisen, he should apply the strong poultice.  The ultimate time has come; a moment is the best time for death.  "

text: तत्रानुलोमिकं स्नेहक्षारमूत्राम्लकल्पितम्। त्वरितं स्निग्धतीक्ष्णोष्णं बस्तिमन्यं प्रपीडियेत्॥ विदद्यात्फलवर्ति वा स्वेदनोत् त्रासनादि च। स्वयमेव निवृत्ते तु द्वितीयो बस्तिरिष्यते॥
en_dmt: "There, an *anulomika* enema should be prepared with oil, alkali, urine, and sour gruel. Then another enema, which is quick, unctuous, sharp, and hot, should be administered. Or a suppository or fomentation, frightening etc., should be applied. When it has ceased by itself, a second enema is desired.  "

text: तृतीयोऽपि चतुर्थोऽपि यावद्वा सुनिरूढता। विरिक्तवच्च योगादीन्विद्यात् योगे तु भोजयेत्॥
en_dmt: "Even the third, even the fourth, or as long as the stability is very firm, one should understand *yoga* and the like as being empty, and in *yoga* one should nourish [oneself].  "

text: कोष्णेन वारिणा स्नानं तनुधन्वरसौदनम्। विकारा ये निरूढस्य भवन्ति प्रचलैर्मलैः॥
en_dmt: "Bathing with warm water [removes] emaciation, weakness, and fatigue. The disorders of one whose impurities are deeply rooted become mobile.  "

text: ते सुखोष्णाम्बुसिक्तस्य यान्ति भुक्तवतः शमम्। अथ वातार्दितं भूयः सद्य एवानुवासयेत्॥
en_dmt: "They bring relief to one who has eaten, [and] who is sprinkled with comfortably warm water. Then, if afflicted by wind, one should immediately administer an enema again.  "

text: सम्यग्धीनातियोगाश्च तस्य स्युः स्नेहपीतवत्। किञ्चित्कालं स्थितो यश्च सपुरीषो निवर्तते॥
en_dmt: "Perfect meditation and extreme yoga will be his, like one who has drunk oil. And he who has remained for a short time returns with feces.  "

text: सानुलोमानिलः स्नेहस्तत्सिद्धमनुवासनम्। एकं त्रीन् वा बलासे तु स्नेहबस्तीन् प्रकल्पयेत्॥
en_dmt: "*Sānuloma* wind, *sneha* (oil), and that which is prepared with it [are used for] *anuvāsana* enema. One, two, or three *sneha bastis* should be administered when there is *balāsa* (phlegm).  "

text: पञ्च वा सप्त वा पित्ते, नवैकादश वाऽनिले। पुनस्ततोऽप्ययुग्मांस्तु पुनरास्थापनं ततः॥
en_dmt: "In cases of bile, five or seven; in cases of wind, nine or eleven. Then again, odd numbers from that; then re-establishment from that.  "

text: कफपित्तानिलेष्वन्नं यूषक्षीररसौः क्रमात्। वातघ्नौषधनिष्क्वाथत्रिवृतासैन्धवैर्युतः॥
en_dmt: "For kapha, pitta, and vāta, food should be in the form of broth, milk, and juice, respectively. A decoction of vāta-subduing herbs mixed with Trivṛt and rock salt.  "

text: बस्तिरेकोऽनिले स्निग्धः स्वाद्वम्लोष्णो रसान्वितः। न्यग्रोधादिगणक्वाथ-पद्मकादिसितायुतौ॥
en_dmt: "In vāta, an enema should be oleaginous, and endowed with sweet, sour, and hot tastes. [It can be prepared] with a decoction of the banyan tree group, or with *padmaka* etc., and sugar.  "

text: पित्ते स्वादुहिमौ साज्य-क्षीरेक्षुरसमाक्षिकौ। आरग्वधादिनिष्क्वाथ-वत्सकादियुतास्रयः॥
en_dmt: "In cases of pitta, sweet and cold [things] such as ghee, milk, sugarcane juice, and honey are beneficial. Also beneficial are cooling infusions made with *āragvadha* etc., and drinks mixed with *vatsaka* etc.  "

text: रूक्षाः सक्षौद्रगोमूत्रास्तीक्ष्णोष्णकटुकाः कफे। त्रयस्ते सन्निपातेऽपि दोषान् घ्नन्ति यतः क्रमात्॥
en_dmt: "In *kapha*, dry substances along with honey and cow's urine, and pungent, hot, and sharp substances [are beneficial]. Because these three gradually eliminate the *doṣas*, even in *sannipāta* [conditions].  "

text: त्रिभ्यः परं बस्तिमतो नेच्छन्त्यन्ये चिकित्सकाः। न हि दोषश्चतुर्थोऽस्ति पुनर्दीयेत यं प्रति॥
en_dmt: "Other physicians do not approve of *basti* [enemas] after three [days]. Indeed, there is no fourth fault that could be given in return.  "

text: उत्क्लेशनं शुद्धिकरं दोषाणां शमनं क्रमात्। त्रिधैव कल्पयेद्वस्तिमित्यन्येऽपि प्रचक्षते॥
